iaik.x509.net.ldap

Class Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.URLStreamHandler
      • iaik.x509.net.ldap.Handler

  • public class Handler
extends java.net.URLStreamHandler
    A protocol handler for the LDAP protocol. Used by the URL class to resolve ldap://... style URLs.

    For using this Handler it has to be registered within the java.net URL framework. Regsitration can be performed in three different ways:

    1. Use the java.protocol.handler.pkgs system property: 
              System.getProperties().put("java.protocol.handler.pkgs", "iaik.x509.net");
    2. Register the LdapURLStreamHandlerFactory for this handler: 
              URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory(new LdapURLStreamHandlerFactory());
    3. If you are using JDK 1.2 or later you can specify the handler dynamically when creating an URL object, e.g.: 
              URL u = new URL(null, "ldap://...", new iaik.x509.net.ldap.Handler());
      In this case the handler will be used for the one particular URL object only. Thus you may have to create all your ldap URLs in this way. Also note that you do not need to create a new Handler object each time, you can use the same for all URLs.
    See Also:
    LdapURLConnection, LdapURLStreamHandlerFactory

    • Method Detail

      • openConnection

        protected java.net.URLConnection openConnection(java.net.URL url)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an LdapURLConnection object to be used for connecting to the ldap server specified by the given URL argument. This method is used by the java.net URL framework and typically will not be called immediately by an application.
        Specified by:
        openConnection in class java.net.URLStreamHandler
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to which to connect to
        Returns:
        an LdapURLConnection object for the given URL.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the LdapURLConnection
